steps.serverDesc: Saving to DB, generating config, testing, reloading Nginx...
steps.additionalDesc: Saving bot filter, GeoIP and other settings...

priorityAllowIPs.title: Priority Allow IPs
priorityAllowIPs.description: These IPs/CIDRs will bypass GeoIP restrictions, Bot Filter, and other security checks. Add internal services or monitoring systems.
priorityAllowIPs.note: IPs and CIDR ranges in this list have highest priority and bypass all blocks.

security.exploitRulesDescription: Manage exploit blocking rules and exceptions in the centralized WAF settings.
security.fail2banDescription: Automatically ban IPs after repeated failed attempts (401/403 errors).
security.fail2banSettingsDescription: Configure ban time, max retries, and other settings.

botFilter.title: Bot Filter
botFilter.allowSearchEnginesDescription: Allow Google, Bing, and other search engine bots
botFilter.blockSuspiciousDescription: Block clients with abnormal request patterns
botFilter.customBlockedPlaceholder: Enter User-Agents to block, one per line
botFilter.settingsLink: Bot lists can be customized in <1>Settings → Bot Filter</1>

geoip.title: GeoIP Restriction
geoip.notAvailableDescription: Configure MaxMind GeoIP in Settings → GeoIP
geoip.description: Allow or block traffic from specific countries
geoip.allowPrivateIPsDescription: Private IP ranges (10.x.x.x, 172.16-31.x.x, 192.168.x.x) bypass GeoIP blocking
geoip.allowSearchBotsDescription: Search engine bots (Google, Bing, Yahoo, etc.) bypass GeoIP restrictions

cloudProvider.title: Cloud Provider Blocking
cloudProvider.description: Block traffic from known cloud service providers
cloudProvider.warning: Traffic from selected cloud providers will be blocked. This may affect legitimate users accessing through VPNs or cloud-based services.
cloudProvider.challengeModeDescription: Show CAPTCHA verification instead of blocking
cloudProvider.challengeWarning: Traffic from selected cloud providers will be shown a CAPTCHA challenge before accessing the site.
cloudProvider.allowSearchBotsDescription: Allow search engine bots (Google, Bing, etc.) to bypass cloud blocking

uriBlock.title: URI Path Blocking
uriBlock.description: Block access to specific URI paths
uriBlock.exceptionIPsPlaceholder:
Enter IP addresses that bypass blocking
One per line

notAvailable.title: Protection settings available after saving
notAvailable.description: Save the proxy host first, then edit it again to configure Rate Limit, Fail2ban, Security Headers, and other protection settings.

securityHeaders.title: Security Headers
securityHeaders.advancedHeadersDesc: These headers can break your website if misconfigured. Please add them manually in the Advanced tab using nginx configuration.

bannedIPs.title: Banned IPs
bannedIPs.manageCentrally: Manage all banned IPs in the central Banned IPs page

cache.title: Caching
cache.description: Cache static files to improve performance
cache.staticOnlyDesc: Only cache static files (js, css, images, fonts). API paths are always excluded.
cache.infoStaticOnly: Only static assets (js, css, images, fonts) will be cached
cache.infoAll: All responses except /api/* paths will be cached

config.title: Custom Nginx Configuration
config.warning: Invalid configuration may cause the proxy host to fail

help.domainNames: Enter the web addresses (e.g., blog.mysite.com) that visitors will use. Press Enter to add multiple. Wildcards like *.mysite.com are supported.
help.forwardHost: The IP address or container name of your internal server. 'Container Name' is best if on the same Docker network.
help.forwardScheme: Protocol to use for communicating with the internal service. Use 'https' only if the internal service handles its own SSL.
help.forwardPort: The port number your internal service is listening on (e.g., 80 for web, 3000 for Node.js).
help.websocket: Must be enabled for apps using real-time communication like Signal or Socket.io.

ssl.enabled: Enables SSL/TLS encryption for secure data transmission.
ssl.forceHttps: Redirects all HTTP traffic to HTTPS. Highly recommended for security.
ssl.http2: Modern protocol for faster page loads. Recommended for most sites.
ssl.http3: Next-gen protocol using QUIC/UDP. Faster on mobile/unstable networks. Requires UDP port 443.
ssl.hsts: Tells browsers to ONLY use HTTPS for this site. Be careful, as this is cached by browsers.

security.priorityAllowIPs: Trusted IPs that bypass all blocks (GeoIP, Bot Filter, etc.). Use for internal monitoring or partners.
security.blockExploits: Blocks common attack patterns like SQL Injection and XSS.
security.blockExploitsExceptions: Add URL patterns that should bypass exploit blocking. Useful for APIs that legitimately pass URLs as parameters (like WordPress oEmbed or webhooks).
security.waf: Web Application Firewall (ModSecurity) provides deep packet inspection to block sophisticated attacks.
security.botFilter: Allows search engines (Google, Bing) while blocking malicious scrapers and spambots.
security.cloudProvider: Block IP ranges from cloud providers like AWS, Azure, and GCP. Useful against spam/scraping bots running on cloud servers. Note: May affect legitimate VPN users.
security.cloudProviderChallenge: Enable challenge mode to show CAPTCHA verification instead of blocking traffic from cloud IPs. Legitimate users can pass the challenge, while bots are blocked.
security.cloudProviderAllowSearchBots: Allow search engine bots (Google, Bing, Yandex, etc.) to bypass cloud provider blocking. This ensures your site can be indexed even when cloud IPs are blocked.

protection.rateLimit: Prevents abuse by limiting how many requests an IP can make. 'Burst' is the temporary allowance.
protection.fail2ban: Automatically bans IPs that repeatedly fail authentication or make bad requests.
protection.securityHeaders: Adds standard security headers to protect against browser-based attacks like Clickjacking.

securityHeadersDetail.hsts: HSTS tells browsers to ONLY connect via HTTPS. Once enabled, browsers will remember this for the specified duration. Warning: If you later disable SSL, visitors may be unable to access your site until the HSTS cache expires.
securityHeadersDetail.includeSubdomains: Applies HSTS to all subdomains (e.g., api.example.com, blog.example.com). Only enable if ALL your subdomains support HTTPS.
securityHeadersDetail.xFrameOptions:
Prevents your site from being embedded in iframes on other sites (clickjacking protection).
• DENY: Never allow framing
• SAMEORIGIN: Only allow framing from your own domain
securityHeadersDetail.referrerPolicy:
Controls how much URL information is sent when users click links to other sites.
• no-referrer: Send nothing (most private)
• strict-origin: Send only domain name over HTTPS
• strict-origin-when-cross-origin: Full URL to same site, only domain to others (recommended)
securityHeadersDetail.xContentType: Prevents browsers from guessing file types (MIME sniffing). Protects against attacks where malicious files are disguised as harmless ones like images.
securityHeadersDetail.xssProtection: Enables the browser's built-in XSS (cross-site scripting) filter. Note: Modern browsers have this deprecated in favor of Content-Security-Policy, but it provides backward compatibility.

performance.cache: Caches static assets (images, CSS) to reduce server load and speed up loading.
performance.cacheStaticOnly: Caches only static files (js, css, images, fonts). API responses and HTML are not cached, ensuring dynamic content stays fresh.
performance.cacheTTL: How long cached files are stored. Use shorter durations for frequently updated sites, longer for static sites.
performance.compression: Compresses responses to reduce data usage and improve speed.
performance.websocket: Enables WebSocket support (Upgrade header) for real-time communication.

advanced.customConfig: For experts. Inject custom Nginx directives into the location / { ... } block.

actions.enableConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to enable the {{domain}} proxy host?
actions.disableConfirmMessage: Are you sure you want to disable the {{domain}} proxy host? Traffic to this domain will be interrupted.

test.title: Configuration Test
test.sslNotEnabled: SSL is not enabled for this host

http.altSvcDesc: This header advertises HTTP/3 support to compatible browsers

cache.miss: Not in cache, fetched from origin

security.hideServer: Consider hiding this header to reduce information disclosure

validation.domainAtLeastOne: At least one domain is required
validation.certificateRequired: Select a certificate to use SSL
validation.certSelectionRequired: Please select a certificate or switch to "Create New"
validation.addDomainsBeforeCert: Add domains first to create certificate
